DataElement.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Version 4 Child Self-Report Social Functioning Scaled Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the scaled score for the Social Functioning scale in the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Version 4, Child Self-Report form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory, Version 4 PedsQL-4 Child Report Social Functioning Scale Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A modular instrument for measuring health-related quality of life in children and adolescents ages 2 to 18. The PedsQL combines both generic core scales and disease-specific modules._A self-report questionnaire that assesses health-related quality of life in children and adolescents ages 8 to 12._A rating scale included in the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Version 4 (PedsQL 4.0) that measures problems with how well a child gets along with others._The mean value computed as the sum of the individual items in a scale over the number of items answered in that scale.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory, Version 4
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A modular instrument for measuring health-related quality of life in children and adolescents ages 2 to 18. The PedsQL combines both generic core scales and disease-specific modules.

Concepts.longName: Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory, Version 4
Concepts.definition: A modular instrument for measuring health-related quality of life in children and adolescents ages 2 to 18. The PedsQL combines both generic core scales and disease-specific modules.

Property.preferredName: PedsQL-4 Child Report PedsQL-4 Social Functioning Scale PedsQL-4 Scale Score
Property.preferredDefinition: A self-report questionnaire that assesses health-related quality of life in children and adolescents ages 8 to 12.:A rating scale included in the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Version 4 (PedsQL 4.0) that measures problems with how well a child gets along with others.:The mean value computed as the sum of the individual items in a scale over the number of items answered in that scale.

Concepts.definition: A self-report questionnaire that assesses health-related quality of life in children and adolescents ages 8 to 12.
A rating scale included in the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory Version 4 (PedsQL 4.0) that measures problems with how well a child gets along with others.
The mean value computed as the sum of the individual items in a scale over the number of items answered in that scale.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for COG study in Rave per request by W.Wong. mc 4/6/15

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that represents the conversion of a raw score to a common scale from the Pediatric Quality of Life Inventory.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
